Recomiendo el juego, si te gusta el zombies compralo, si lo quieres por multijugador y campaña, sal de aqui :0

185571121.review:
Black Ops 3 IS a great game, however it's arguably one of the worst games you could play through Steam.
You'll know this already from the other reviews but the RCE and RAT issues aren't just annoying or tedious, depending on who you are they're absolutely DANGEROUS.

Play with the T7 patch and Boiii/T7x client if you absolutely can't live without BO3

I refunded my one because my PC wouldn't let me play on the client for some reason, probably my own issue tbh, but I'll be buying again to get into modding and making custom MP maps for people like me who love offline bot gameplay. Plus the new clients are worth trying.

BUY ON A SALE AND USE EXTERNAL CLIENTS/PATCHES, DO NOT spend £45+ on this 10 year old RAT riddled game. If the RCE/RAT issues weren't present I'd still say the asking price is absurd but with the issues it has the price is downright criminal

185570012.review:
Brought the game back in about 2022 and had fun with the Zombies mode with friends back then which is all I really cared about, since then however the game has become absolutely unplayable.

After downloading the game I had to deal with multiple crashes on startup, that could only be fixed by disabling any audio software I use that has never caused any issues with any other game or program I've used, both old and new.

After that I had to deal with a constant stuttering that would freeze the game every 2-3 seconds regardless of where I was in the game, or what my graphical/screen settings were, with the only two fixes I could find online being either to boot the game completely offline, meaning I just straight up couldn't play it with friends again, or use a community patch to fix the issues, after applying one of the fixes and loading into a basic zombies map, being Kino Der Toten, then pausing to adjust some gameplay settings, my entire pc hard froze, forcing to obviously reset my pc to continue to do anything with it.

These issues seem to stem from an update made back in 2023 that Activision/Treyarch pushed out that has not been fixed, with seemingly complete radio silence from both teams on ever making the game playable for the average consumer ever again, with the only action being taken is removing the Multiplayer tag from their official tags to shake off any responsibility they may have to take for the state that they have left their previous games in.

185544252.review:
Call of Duty®: Black Ops III — це одна з найбільш багатогранних частин серії, яка пропонує широкий спектр контенту, включаючи сюжетну кампанію, кооперативний режим, багатокористувацькі бої та зомбі-режим
Переваги:
Сюжетна кампанія:
Кампанія пропонує унікальний науково-фантастичний сюжет, дія якого відбувається у 2065 році.
Доступний кооперативний режим на чотирьох гравців, що додає варіативності проходженню.
Наявність опції «Nightmares Mode», яка перетворює звичайну кампанію в боротьбу проти зомбі.
Багатокористувацький режим:
Додані «Спеціалісти» — герої з унікальними здібностями та зброєю.
Вдосконалена система руху: біг по стінах, подвійні стрибки та ковзання додають динаміки.
Різноманітність карт і режимів гри.
Зомбі-режим:
Унікальна атмосфера, де сюжет також має вагоме значення.
Карта «Shadows of Evil» із нуарною стилістикою та кастомізацією зброї.
Можливість прокачувати персонажа.
Графіка та звук:
Покращена графіка, особливо на новому поколінні консолей.
Саундтрек і звукові ефекти створюють атмосферу напруження.
Недоліки:
Сюжет:
Кампанія може здатися заплутаною або перевантаженою для тих, хто очікує класичної військової драми.
Оптимізація:
На старті гра мала технічні проблеми на деяких платформах, хоча з часом багато з них виправили патчами.
Спеціалісти:
Нововведення з героями сподобалося не всім фанатам, адже воно дещо змінює класичний підхід до геймплею.
        Загалом, Call of Duty: Black Ops III завоювала популярність серед шанувальників серії, зокрема через свій мультиплеєрний та кооперативний досвід, а також захоплюючі моменти у режимі зомбі.

185415966.review:
Black Ops 3’s Zombies mode is a standout experience that blends intense co-op gameplay with thrilling, round-based action. The maps are creatively designed, each offering unique settings, challenges, and Easter eggs to uncover. From the iconic “Shadows of Evil” to “The Giant” and beyond, each map feels meticulously crafted, with a variety of pathways, secrets, and challenges to keep players coming back for more.

The mechanics are solid, offering tight, satisfying gunplay while introducing features like the GobbleGum system, which adds a layer of strategy by giving players powerful perks during gameplay. The perk system itself is well-balanced, and the addition of new weapons and equipment further enhances the experience, allowing for creative strategies as you fight off increasingly difficult waves of the undead.

What really sets Black Ops 3 Zombies apart is its replayability. The ever-expanding world of Easter eggs, hidden storylines, and complex objectives means there's always something new to discover. Whether you're playing solo or teaming up with friends, the cooperative gameplay keeps things fresh, with plenty of opportunities to strategize and adapt to the shifting tides of the zombie apocalypse.

That said, the difficulty can ramp up quickly, making for tense, challenging sessions. However, the reward of surviving waves and unlocking new content makes it incredibly satisfying.

Overall, Black Ops 3’s Zombies mode is an absolute blast, offering endless fun for fans of co-op shooters and zombie fans alike. It’s packed with content, challenges, and secrets, ensuring that players always have something new to tackle. If you enjoy a mix of strategy, teamwork, and chaos, this mode is a must-play.

185382925.review:
Train go Boom.
I Started this game in November 2022 and ended in March 2024
I can't for the life of me understand why this game is hated. Sure, it has none of the characters from the original. But that was 70 years (I think) before this game, you can't expect them to still be around! 
At least you understood to actually have Co-op in this one! Not everyone cares about some silly 5v5 Nuketown in every game!

I played through the campaign and was enraptured, I'm sure my comrade-in-arms wasn't as interested as I and probably remembers less of the story than I. But still, the story didn't feel random. Each event linked to the next as I unravelled the mystery of the Frozen Forest. The intro was one of the best I've seen, it may not be like Vendetta from WaW, but it works well to establish the setting. The waves of Robots emerging from the fog, and the double non-consensual amputation was both mortifying and a spectacle to behold. The environments were proper-set pieces, the ruins of Singapore, massive sand crawlers in Egypt & giant complexes in Switzerland compliment the story very well. Or, what about diving through the minds of our previous squad-mates. Trust me I didn't expect to be fighting King Tigers at Bastogne when I started playing this game, but each time we travelled into someone’s mind. It didn't feel like a tacked-on segment. But a proper interesting part of story. 
Playing through this game in Co-op was a barrel of laughs; forgetting the keys after not playing for 3 months, Nazi zombies showing up halfway through the game, trying to recognise actors from where we've seen them before. Or the hell that was trying to sort out NAT type.
Sure, there were some problems, the NAT type was enraging. But eh, I wasn’t the one who was trying to fix it. :D There were some points where we repeatedly attacked against one position, but that’s more of a comment on our skills rather than of the game itself.
So, I say, "So what?" So, what if it doesn't have any of the established Black Ops characters? This is a marvellous game with a marvellous campaign.

Oh, before I get carried away. There are zombies as well! It’s got gobble-gums and other clutch mechanics, so it really depends on your opinions of those things.

Its good, get it.

185296992.review:
First off, if you plan on purchasing this game (highly recommend the "Zombies Chronicles" edition), definitely go for it when it's on sale. I never understood how Activision still sells 10+ year old games for full price but any way to save yourself some money for a somewhat valuable product is always something worth to consider.

Secondly, unless you have clean access to a mod client that actually works, do NOT play Multiplayer or online Zombies (kind of...). It's absolutely littered with hackers who can easily access all of your personal information outside of the game and possibly demolish your computer. Please be careful!

But the real bread winner of this discussion is "Custom Zombies"...without a shred of doubt whatsoever.

The amount of user created content from the modding community is beyond astounding. There are literal days worth of content to mess around with and a good majority of it being high quality entertainment (there is a lot of junk but you learn to properly sift through it and recognize what's not worth your time the more you explore and play). At the time of writing this review, I've sunk over 400 hours in the past year just purely enjoying the fascinating experiences that some extremely creative people have put an immense amount of time into, and I can honestly say that almost every single minute of it was worth it. Playing with your friends has never been as much fun before, and aside from the occasional crashes or bugs here and there, it's practically seamless to hop in a match together. This is the side of the game that sold me from the start and I hope that my review assists in your decision of whether or not you should get yourself into it as well.

I do have some recommendations with brief descriptions as well for any newcomers who wouldn't really know where to start:
- Shoot Haus
This is an Origins themed zombiefied version of the MW2019 multiplayer map "Shoot House". It takes place during the map "Origins" outside those respective trenches in a nearby settlement where you play as four German soldiers who have managed to survive (so far) and are on a mission to make it back home. Fantastic yet complex Easter Egg, a wonderful yet powerful array of arsenal, returning enemies such as the Panzer alongside some new explosive foes and a layout so familiar yet rejuvenating...one of my personal favorites to this day. 10 out of 10.

- Nightmare
This is nothing like your average zombies map. Taking a more "campaign" approach, use hidden clues and an ever-growing arsenal to survive and solve puzzles to complete this truly one of a kind experience. It's truly best to play it first hand because not enough words can describe how unique this map is without spoiling the map itself. 10/10.

- Kowloon
Inspired by the mission "Numbers" from the original Black Ops campaign, you take a last stand on the rainy rooftops of a zombie infested Hong Kong and fight your way through tight corridors and empty apartments with a refreshing array of weaponry seamlessly pulled from "Black Ops: Cold War", with an Easter Egg that places you in one of the most historic battles known to fiction. Stay vigilant and don't fall off to the darkened streets below. 10/10.

- All-Around Enhancement
This zombies overhaul mod is an absolute must when it comes to playing custom maps. The term "enhancement" is a massive understatement and using it will help define your overall experience to a level never seen before. It may seem extremely overwhelming at first, but once you toy around with all of the options available (which have been streamlined almost to perfection for any type of player) then you'll find the necessity of the mod itself in a matter of mere moments. From HUD/UI color customization, to a universal bank to stash your extra points (good for maps with no Easter Eggs or buyable endings), to quality of life changes like depth of field or its built-in zombie counter, to addable/removable power-up drops, to even smoother field of view options, or even  fun additions like "rainbow eyes", the possibilities are endless.

185183451.review:
Call of Duty: Black Ops III – Ein herausragender Teil der Serie

Black Ops III mag bei einigen Fans gemischte Reaktionen hervorrufen, doch für viele ist es eines der besten Call of Duty-Spiele – vor allem durch die tiefgründige Story, das packende Zombie-Erlebnis und die kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung des Multiplayers. Obwohl die Kampagne und die komplexe Erzählweise bei einigen nicht gut ankamen, zeigt sie doch eine interessante und teils grausame Geschichte rund um Künstliche Intelligenz (KI) und Robotertechnologie, die bei genauerem Hinsehen viel mehr Tiefe bietet, als man auf den ersten Blick vermuten würde.

Die Kampagne – Komplex, aber faszinierend

Die Kampagne von Black Ops III ist bekannt dafür, mit einer verwirrenden Erzählweise und einer Reihe von Wendungen und Geheimnissen zu punkten, die es erfordern, dass der Spieler die Geschichte mehrmals durchspielt, um das volle Ausmaß der Erzählung zu begreifen. Im Mittelpunkt steht die Verbindung zwischen Mensch und Maschine, besonders die ethischen und philosophischen Fragen rund um KI und die Verschmelzung von Menschen mit Technologie. Diese Thematik wird auf eine düstere und erschreckende Weise behandelt, wobei die Frage nach der Kontrolle und den moralischen Implikationen der Schaffung von KI im Mittelpunkt steht. Für viele ist die Kampagne ein faszinierendes, aber komplexes Puzzle, das mehr zu bieten hat, als es auf den ersten Blick scheint.

Zombies – Ein Höhepunkt des Spiels

Das Zombies-Erlebnis in Black Ops III ist definitiv eines der besten, das je in der Call of Duty-Reihe veröffentlicht wurde. Die Zombies Chronicles Edition fügt dem Spiel eine Reihe klassischer Maps hinzu, darunter „The Giant“, in der die Geschichte rund um die bekannten Charaktere Dempsey, Nikolai, Richtofen und Takeo weitergeführt wird. Fans der Serie können die chaotischen und nervenaufreibenden Schlachten gegen die Zombies noch einmal auf eine neue Weise erleben – mit verbesserten Grafiken und neuen Inhalten. Der Multiplayer- und Kooperationsmodus bietet unzählige Stunden an Spielspaß, besonders mit Freunden.

Multiplayer – Spaß, aber mit Problemen

Der Multiplayer in Black Ops III bietet eine eigene Erfahrung, die durch das neue Operator-System und die vielen unterschiedlichen Klassen und Spielstile bereichert wird. Es gibt eine Vielzahl von Waffen, Ausrüstungen und Spezialfähigkeiten, die das Gameplay abwechslungsreich machen. Leider hat der Multiplayer auch seine Schattenseiten, vor allem in Form von Cheatern und Hackern, die das Spielerlebnis beeinträchtigen. Diese Probleme wurden jedoch im Laufe der Zeit durch Updates angegangen, und trotzdem bleibt das Gameplay für viele ein Highlight, auch wenn die Wettbewerbsfähigkeit oft durch solche Störungen getrübt wird.

Fazit – Ein lohnenswertes Erlebnis für die Fans der Reihe

Call of Duty: Black Ops III ist ein komplexes Spiel, das viele Facetten hat – von einer tiefgründigen Kampagne, die sich mit faszinierenden Themen rund um Technologie und KI beschäftigt, über das gefeierte Zombies-Erlebnis bis hin zu einem Multiplayer, der Spaß macht, auch wenn er gelegentlich mit Problemen zu kämpfen hat. Wer die Zeit investiert und die Geschichte gründlich erkundet, wird feststellen, dass Black Ops III mehr zu bieten hat als viele andere Titel der Reihe. Es bleibt ein Highlight, besonders für die Fans des Zombies-Modus und diejenigen, die eine tiefere, manchmal düstere Erzählung zu schätzen wissen.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 est incontestablement l'un des meilleurs jeux de la franchise, et son mode zombie en particulier est souvent considéré comme le meilleur de tous les Call of Duty (COD). Le jeu propose une expérience multijoueur riche, mais c'est vraiment son mode zombie qui le distingue.

Le mode zombie de BO3 est une véritable référence. Il combine un gameplay stratégique avec une profondeur narrative impressionnante. Les cartes comme Shadows of Evil, The Giant, et Der Eisendrache offrent non seulement des environnements superbes, mais aussi des mécaniques innovantes, comme des pouvoirs spéciaux, des énigmes à résoudre et des trésors à découvrir.

La coopération entre joueurs, les différents types de zombies et les nombreux secrets à découvrir créent une expérience extrêmement immersive. De plus, les easter eggs sont parmi les plus complexes et satisfaisants à réaliser, ajoutant une dimension supplémentaire au jeu. En termes de contenu, de rejouabilité et de plaisir pur, BO3 surclasse bien des autres COD dans ce domaine.

Bref, si tu es fan de zombies, Black Ops 3 reste l'un des meilleurs choix à faire !

184846921.review:
Only worth playing when Dark Souls 2 servers are down.

When the Dark Souls 2 servers are down, Black Ops 3 can certainly fill the void as a decent distraction, offering a more casual, action-packed experience. It’s fun to play with friends or engage in competitive multiplayer, but it pales in comparison to the grueling, rewarding journey that Dark Souls 2 provides. Dark Souls 2 isn’t just a game—it’s a test of endurance, skill, and patience, where every victory is earned through immense effort. In contrast, Black Ops 3 doesn’t demand that same level of commitment or mastery. It’s an enjoyable game when Dark Souls 2 isn’t an option, but once the servers are up and running again, it becomes clear that Dark Souls 2 is the superior choice—offering not just a game, but a transformative experience that Black Ops 3 can never hope to match.

184535118.review:
DO NOT BUY if you plan to play multiplayer or zombies with friends.

There are RCE vulnerabilities which I experienced myself while playing solo zombies. After uninstalling, it didn't happen again. A Chinese IP was trying to install a Trojan remotely through BO3.

Be really careful. Treyarch and Activision don't care at all about games which are not the latest ones (you could even argue if they do in that case).

As people are asking me, I detected such through Malwarebytes. Any antivirus should do.

I still have the logs, it was detected as blocking a website from within "SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\Call of Duty Black Ops III\BlackOps3.exe", category "Trojan", with a connection of "Outbound". The IP was a proxy one from China (Alibaba Cloud).

Be safe!

184531349.review:
"Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 – Great Game, Greedy Publisher"
"Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 is one of the best entries in the franchise, no question. From wall-running in multiplayer to endless hours of Zombies chaos, the gameplay is a blast. But let’s address the real issue here: Activision’s pricing.

This game came out in 2015. Let me say that again—2015. We’re now in 2025, and Black Ops 3 still costs as much as a new AAA release. Want the full experience? Add the Zombies Chronicles DLC, and suddenly you’re questioning if you should just buy a new graphics card instead.

And here’s the kicker: Even during a Steam sale, the discounts barely make a dent. Meanwhile, other developers are out here giving away entire games for free or offering massive discounts on their classics. Activision? Nah, they’re squeezing every last cent from a decade-old game.

What You’re Paying For:
Multiplayer: Sweaty lobbies where you get no-scoped by 12-year-olds.
Zombies: Amazing, but you’ll need to sell your soul (and wallet) for the DLCs.
Campaign: It's there, but you’ll spend more time paying for it than playing it.
Activision is like the Mystery Box: you spend too much, and most of the time, you don’t even get what you want.

Would I recommend this game? Yes, but only if you have Double Tap for your bank account. Otherwise, wait until the year 2050 when Activision might finally consider a real discount."

I have been avoiding COD games since Black Ops 2. 
This garbage was on sale for 20 euros during 2024's winter sale. 
That is nearly 10 years after this game launched and it is still that expnesive. 
Not to mention if you want access to all multiplayer and zombie maps you gotta pay extra for the dlcs as well. 

I also got Titanfall 2 during the wintersale for 3 euros. And I gotta say, Titanfall 2 beats this game in every single fucking aspect. 
Titanfall 2 is a game that comes out only a year later after Black Ops 3 and not only does it run TWICE as better (black ops fps for me is 80-100 while in titanfall it's 240) but feels super smooth and resposive as well.
Black ops 3 stutters from time to time for me as well, dropping the fps by about 20 to 30.

I tried to play the infamous ZOMBIES gamemode and despite steam charts saying it has a player base of about 6.5k players that log in DAILY, it took me 40 MINUTES to find my first zombie game!!!
Not to mention how insanely retarded matchmaking has been made in this game.
You cannot for example select which maps you want to play on official servers. 
By official I mean, unmodded servers with developer zombie maps.
So all you can do is only choose ONE map and then you start searching for games for that map, you can see a percentage of players playing it.
Most of the times it says 0% so don't even bother, but if it says something like 10-15% look for a game.
I find it abysmal how I cannot select multiple maps I want to play or even all of them and just let the game find a match and join the game for whichever map it may be, I have to go through every single map individually searching for a game.
And even if there is a way to select multiple maps, I have not found it, nothing about the interface of this game is easy to understand for me. 
For a game in 2015, there should be an award for how terrible that searching for a lobby is done in this game. 
The alternative is just hosting your own game if you have friends or you can go on Discord servers to look for people, but with a player base of 6.5 players I did not expect this game to feel so empty, perhaps the majority is on the PVP action.

I started to get crashes too whenever the game detects changes in my network and the whole network connectivity system, whatever it is in this game is incredibly confusing and weird to me and makes 0 sense for a game from 2015 again. 
I play titanfall 2 and many other multiplayer games with no problems in terms of my internet and this game is trying to tell me that my connection is bad or something.

This game TRULY managed to live up to the HATE I've developed for COD games over the past decade and managed to destroy any hopes of me enjoying this game.
It is messy, cluncky and just feels unpolished and broken compared to a masterpiece like Titanfall 2. (which was on sale for 3 euros and this shit was 20)

This has got to be one of the biggest scams of my life. 
Paid like 30 euros for absolutely 0 content and entertainment.
Utter garbage, if you want something similar in gameplay, just get Titanfall 2 (playerbase is 5.8k players and they feel way more active across co op and pvp gamemodes)

My thoughts are this. Funny enough, I fucking love Black Ops 3. One of my favorite cod games, third to bo1 and 2 (no joke intended). But Activision refuses to fix the ever looming RAT/RCE exploit within all cod games 2018 and below. Here is some information for those who are confused. And yes, this applies to EVERY cod 2018 and below. MW 2019 and up (beside Cold War, which is unsafe), are okay to play. *Note I did not research and write this myself, I do not take credit for finding this info*

DO NOT OPEN ANY COD PRIOR TO IW
They took away Xlabs, Sm2, and soon will take away Plutonium which are all the ONLY safe way to play these older CoDs.
Opening any CoD prior to IW will result in a chance for people to gain access to your pc. 2 security breaches are known:
CVE-2018-20817
(SV_SteamAuthClient in various Activision Infinity Ward Call of Duty games before 2015-08-11 is missing a size check when reading authBlob data into a buffer, which allows one to execute code on the remote target machine when sending a steam authentication request. This affects Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2, Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty: Ghosts, Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare, Call of Duty: Black Ops 1, and Call of Duty: Black Ops 2.)
CVE-2018-10718
(Stack-based buffer overflow in Activision Infinity Ward Call of Duty Modern Warfare 2 before 2018-04-26 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted packets)
These are some things they can do even if you just boot up the game and get to the menu:
Hidden Remote System Access
System Information
File Manager
Hidden Desktop Usage
Monitor on/off
Hidden Browser Usage
Open/close CD
Hidden Chrome Usage

Évaluation : 🌟🌟🌟🌟 (4/5)
"Call of Duty: Black Ops III, entre innovation et nostalgie, offre une expérience multijoueur solide, une campagne coopérative ambitieuse, et le meilleur des zombies."

Call of Duty: Black Ops III, développé par Treyarch, pousse les limites de la franchise avec des mécaniques futuristes et une personnalisation accrue. Ce titre mélange des modes de jeu variés et une jouabilité rafraîchie, bien que la narration puisse diviser et que le gameplay futuriste ne convienne pas à tous les fans de la série.

Les Points Forts :
✅ Multijoueur varié et addictif : Avec son système de spécialistes offrant des capacités uniques, BO3 introduit une nouvelle dimension stratégique au PvP. Les cartes sont bien conçues pour exploiter les mouvements dynamiques, tels que les wall-runs et les glissades.

✅ Mode Zombies de légende : Treyarch brille avec son mode Zombies, proposant des cartes immersives comme Shadows of Evil et Der Eisendrache, remplies d’œufs de Pâques complexes et d’une ambiance incomparable.

✅ Personnalisation poussée : Que ce soit en multijoueur, en campagne, ou en Zombies, la personnalisation des armes, des classes et même des compétences améliore l’expérience.

✅ Campagne jouable en coop : La possibilité de jouer la campagne à 4 joueurs en ligne est une excellente idée qui ajoute de la rejouabilité.

✅ Mouvements fluides et futuristes : Les exo-mouvements, bien intégrés, ajoutent une nouvelle dynamique à la franchise sans surcharger le gameplay.

✅ Mode "Nightmares" : Une version alternative de la campagne où les ennemis sont remplacés par des zombies, offrant un défi inédit.

Les Points Faibles :
⚠️ Scénario confus et peu engageant : L’histoire, bien que ambitieuse, souffre d’un rythme inégal et de rebondissements parfois mal amenés. Les joueurs cherchant une intrigue captivante pourraient rester sur leur faim.

⚠️ Progression multijoueur exigeante : Le grind pour débloquer des armes et des cosmétiques peut être frustrant pour les nouveaux joueurs.

⚠️ Problèmes d’équilibrage : Certains spécialistes et armes sont clairement dominants, ce qui peut nuire à l’expérience compétitive.

⚠️ Connexion obligatoire : Même pour des modes solo comme Zombies, une connexion internet est souvent nécessaire, ce qui peut frustrer certains joueurs.

En conclusion :
Call of Duty: Black Ops III est une entrée ambitieuse dans la franchise, avec des ajouts innovants comme le système de spécialistes et la coopération en campagne. Le mode Zombies reste un point fort indéniable, offrant des heures de plaisir. Cependant, l’histoire principale et certains choix de design peuvent diviser. Malgré ses défauts, BO3 est un excellent choix pour les fans de multijoueur et d’expériences Zombies riches en contenu.

🎮 Verdict final :
Un Call of Duty complet et audacieux, idéal pour les amateurs de gameplay rapide et varié. Si vous aimez le multijoueur et le mode Zombies, vous ne serez pas déçu.

⏳ Temps de jeu recommandé :

Campagne : 8 à 10 heures.
Multijoueur et Zombies : Des centaines d’heures selon votre investissement.
✨ Note personnelle : "Shadows of Evil" est une masterclass du mode Zombies. Et les wall-runs ? Toujours aussi satisfaisants à maîtriser ! 🧟‍♂️🔫

184231809.review:
I have mixed feelings for BO3. I started playing Black ops 3 on the xbox 360 and it was hard to play on, Janky and broken animations, the graphics looked really awful and there was less customisation. Zombies only had like 2 dlcs and that was it. Im glad i got away from that and got all the dlcs for PC. 

First things first - Zombies

The best thing that carries this game is zombies. The fact that there is a ranking system in zombies proves that they have worked on the zombies alot. Now i know this also applies for the campaign but we will get to that soon enough. They have worked profoundly well on the zombies mode and im glad about this. From adding zombies chronicles to adding custom maps for the community. Although these are like 5 gbs on average, They are still very fun to play. The remakes for the old maps are amazing too. Im glad they havent just remastered them and done nothing but change the graphics, They have actually added more details and remade the maps. They have done an excellent job with this. There is so much more to do and so many more easter eggs to complete. For example der eisendrache. The four swords and bows seem very fun to grind for in zombies and i will be attempting this in the near future. My Favourite map they have remade has to rather be origins or Kino der toten. They put so much detail into these and im very glad about it 

Second thing i wanna talk about is the campaign - The campaign doesnt seem to make sense (I love the quote "train go boom" though that made me chuckle) But apart from that, every person that has talked about the campaign has always called it confusing and underwritten. I want to believe this from them because from watching the campaigns cutscenes. It does look confusing. The only thing i like is the ranking system. Its a good idea to include something like that.

Two Gamemodes i want to talk about - Multiplayer + Bonus Gamemodes

Lets talk about multiplayer first. The multiplayer deserves atleast a 7/10. Theres something about it that makes me feel mixed about it. First of all some players can gain a huge advantage with some weapons if they have practiced with them quite alot. Lets say for example the ICR. The ICR is an instaheadshot kill weapon and its too OP. I have gotten killed quite alot from players like that. Its pretty annoying

Finally i want to talk about the bonus gamemodes (Nightmares, freerun and Dead ops arcade_

Nightmares - Thats not much to say, its just campaign with zombies, i like the idea of it but its quite annoiyng to progress sicne zombies will get in your way alot. Fun gamemode to play with friends though

Freerun - A perfect gamemode for using the EXO ability. All you have to do is parkour to progress and it is quite fun to play. 

Dead ops arcade 2 - Its much better than the first one. A huge improvement. I loved the ability to go into first person while playing dead ops. Its a pretty well thought of idea, Theres also more maps to progress to so theres more grinding (idk if the first one had that too) Overall its just more fun than the first one

Sorry if there isnt alot of words for each gamemode, I couldnt think of alot to say but overall the game deserves a 7/10. WAW, BO1 and BO2 were much better than BO3. But good job treyarch you never make me feel dissapointed (aside from BO4 but we dont talk about that)

184188877.review:
I actually quite enjoyed the game, but I feel the need to leave a negative review out of principle for a rather simple reason: the game is NOT SAFE TO PLAY on official servers. The worst issues that could let cheaters ruin your entire computer have been fixed, but it is still possible for them to brick your game account with infinite crashes or hacked stats. People wanting to play in public lobbies are forced to play with a fanmade patch that doesn't track official stats or achievements. For a game still being sold for $60-100, that is outright ridiculous and unacceptable.

The rest of this will be based on the zombies mode, since I assume that would be the only reason most people would still buy this game so long after its support ended. Many people consider this to be the best zombies mode to date, and the reasons for it are pretty valid. The actual amount of content is great, with 6 new maps and 8 retrained maps from past games. It introduced some very good new features to the game, such as weapon kits to customize camos/attachments for zombies and (optional) consumable buffs in the form of gobblegums. 

In terms of the gameplay, it remains the same as always; endless survival against rounds of ever-stronger zombies with a handful of tools to help you out. It is worth noting that some aspects of the game were changed rather drastically. For example, it now takes 3 hits to down without juggernog instead of 2. The trade-off is that zombies are much more aggressive, with even a single zombie on low rounds being able to keep chaining hits in rapid succession without the "delay" they used to have. Spawns also seem to follow you much more aggressively, which can actually be rather frustrating in the lower rounds because you will run between a few rooms trying to find the last zombie and it will keep respawning back and forth between different barriers, too far outside the map to be seen. It is also worth noting that the new maps take heavy inspiration from origins in terms of content style; with the exception of the giant (as it is basically a remake of der riese), each map has at minimum a shield and sometimes extra items/weapons to craft, with various tasks and upgrades to perform throughout the map and sometimes randomized trials to complete. The easter eggs tend to be rather complicated, but at least all of them except shadows of evil can be completed solo now.

One thing though that I really did not like is the tonal shift of the game and story. Most of the new features can be ignored if you don't like them; you don't have to use gobblegums or craft a shield, it's all optional new content. You can still play the new maps very similarly to how you would play the old maps. However, what you can not change is the story direction and enemies that you fight. Black ops 1 and 2 already took the story in rather dramatic directions, and by origins it was clear that the game was more than just zombies and mad scientists messing with a mysterious new element. This game definitely cranks it up a few levels higher and attempts to establish a whole tragic hero multiverse plot you'd expect to see from an avengers comic book. Instead of just zombies with the occasional local specialty, you are now also engaged in an interdimensional war fighting with and/or against a suite of demonic aliens in some of the maps. I understand that this is a necessary step to establish an identity and avoid the series getting stagnant with the same simplistic things over and over, but it is something that can make the gameplay feel significantly different from the past games if it's not up your alley.

Overall, a pretty fun game and definitely a strong entry into the franchise. Unfortunately, it's still stuck within a rather inept franchise and sold by a publisher who will charge you the full launch-day price to play a 9-year-old game on nearly dead, insecure servers.

184030152.review:
"Attention soldiers... we're going to war." as soon as you start the game, this haunting piece of dialogue plays for the player and it sent chills down my spine. I knew that this was a game about advancing your paladins, but I didn't know it was also a heavy allegory for real life war and battling. And let's just say that this is amazing.

I am often roleplaying as the Team Captain as well as the support for my team. I yell into the mic "Get DOWN! BOMBS! LOOK OUT!" or stuff like "CHECK YOUR SIX! They're dropping bombs FROM THE SKY! TAKE COVER!" and it honestly feels harder than if I were enlisted in the military and dumped on the shores of Ukraine. My teammates are always my brothers in arms and I have to wonder if we all met up if we'd instantly get PTSD and just start crying. It's that immersive.

My only complaint (and I know the game is in beta so it'll probably get fixed) is that there is not enough rock n roll music. I think if they even added a menu toggle that allowed licenced rock and roll music to play during the game I would be satisfied. And I'm not talking about radio play crap like ACDC or Metallica. I'm talking about real rock and roll. If they included music from Garnish the Roses, The Mechaloid Musicoids, or Drashtown I would be in heaven. Make it happen!!!

I think it's amazing that they banged this game out in just one weekend. If you asked me gun to my head if I would pull the trigger if this game ceased to exist, I would empty the chamber in a nanosecond and die on the concrete floor of my bedroom. It's a buy. Add me if you want to go to war!

I loved the game on console. I only refunded this because I know that PC security for Activision Titles for COD are questionable. Playing alone is said to not expose you to this, but playing alone is rather boring for me and I did want to play with others. All I have to say is that the content is amazing! However, be extremely careful about who you play with because PC security is rumored not to be good. So, if you are a zombies fanatic, this game is right up your street! But, if you are mainly into this game for only multiplayer and zombies multiplayer with randoms, exercise caution. 

For the lack of security and fear of me not having a safe experience, on those grounds alone is why I would NOT recommend this game.
